message:
Merge pull request #9747 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-09-19 22:00 UTC

{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "5950403ae9d25f7fefd9c2ccd774b1ec633cf15d",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/concept-transport-layer-security.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 3,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-transport-layer-security.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-transport-layer-security.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-transport-layer-security.md?ref=ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009",
    "patch": "@@ -16,8 +16,7 @@ The Transport Layer Security (TLS) protocol uses certificates at the transport l\n \n > [!IMPORTANT]\n > The Transport Layer Security inspection feature is currently in PREVIEW.   \n-> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before release. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here.   \n-> While in preview, don't use TLS inspection in production environments.      \n+> This information relates to a prerelease product that might be substantially modified before release. Microsoft makes no warranties, expressed or implied, with respect to the information provided here. While in preview, use TLS inspection with care, especially in production environments, thoroughly evaluate before deployment.    \n \n This article gives an overview of the TLS inspection process.\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "3ed25fd967dd2fb7f05d9612144ef4b9a7683057",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/overview-what-is-global-secure-access.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 2,
    "changes": 4,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Foverview-what-is-global-secure-access.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Foverview-what-is-global-secure-access.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Foverview-what-is-global-secure-access.md?ref=ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009",
    "patch": "@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ author: kenwith\n ms.author: kenwith\n manager: dougeby\n ms.topic: overview\n-ms.date: 04/30/2025\n+ms.date: 09/19/2025\n ms.service: global-secure-access\n ms.custom: references_regions\n ai-usage: ai-assisted\n@@ -25,7 +25,7 @@ Microsoft Entra Internet Access and Microsoft Entra Private Access comprise Micr\n \n Microsoft Entra Internet Access and Microsoft Entra Private Access - coupled with Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps, our SaaS-security focused Cloud Access Security Broker (CASB) - are uniquely built as a solution that converges network, identity, and endpoint access controls so you can secure access to any app or resource, from anywhere. With the addition of these Global Secure Access products, Microsoft Entra ID simplifies access policy management and enables access orchestration for employees, business partners, and digital workloads. You can continuously monitor and adjust user access in real time if permissions or risk level changes.\n \n-The Global Secure Access features streamline the roll-out and management of the access control capabilities with a unified portal. These features are delivered from Microsoft's Wide Area Network, spanning 140+ regions and 190+ network edge locations. This private network, which is one of the largest in the world, enables organizations to optimally connect users and devices to public and private resources seamlessly and securely. For a list of the current points of presence, see [Global Secure Access points of presence article](reference-points-of-presence.md).\n+The Global Secure Access features streamline the roll-out and management of the access control capabilities with a unified portal. These features are delivered from Microsoft's Wide Area Network, spanning 70 regions and 190+ network edge locations. This private network, which is one of the largest in the world, enables organizations to optimally connect users and devices to public and private resources seamlessly and securely. For a list of the current points of presence, see [Global Secure Access points of presence article](reference-points-of-presence.md).\n \n ## Microsoft Entra Internet Access\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "5bc1f195580a7cfb84b30d47604442c94e8c7745",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/scripts/powershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 3,
    "deletions": 5,
    "changes": 8,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fscripts%2Fpowershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fscripts%2Fpowershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fscripts%2Fpowershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md?ref=ca243a219b5fa602a3b99bf366c3c071d1acf009",
    "patch": "@@ -63,7 +63,7 @@ try {\n     $response = Get-MgBetaNetworkAccessTlExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificate\n     if ($response.Count -gt 0) {\n         Write-Host \"A certificate for TLS inspection already exists.\"\n-\texit 1\n+\t    exit 1\n     } \n }\n catch {\n@@ -137,7 +137,7 @@ Write-Host \"Generating Root CA key and certificate...\"\n if (Test-Path $csrPath) {\n     Write-Host \"Signing CSR file $csrPath...\"\n     & $openSSLPath x509 -req -in $csrPath -CA $rootCert -CAkey $rootKey -CAcreateserial -out $signedCert -days 370 -sha256 -extfile $opensslCnfPath -extensions signedCA_ext\n-    Write-Host \"Signed certificate saved to $signedCert\"\n+    Write-Host \"Successfully saved signed certificate to $signedCert\"\n } else {\n     Write-Host \"CSR file '$csrPath' not found. Please generate it first.\"\n }\n@@ -147,8 +147,6 @@ $paramsupload = @{\n certificate = Get-Content -Path $SignedCert -Raw\n chain       = Get-Content -Path $RootCert -Raw\n }\n-# Upload using SDK cmdlet\n-Update-MgBetaNetworkAccessTlExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificate -ExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId $externalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId -BodyParameter $paramsupload\n \n # Upload the signed certificate and its chain to Microsoft Graph using the SDK cmdlet.\n # -ExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId: The unique ID of the certificate request previously created.\n@@ -160,7 +158,7 @@ Write-Error \"Failed to upload certificate and chain: $($_.Exception.Message)\"\n exit 1\n }\n \n-Write-Host \"Upload complete via Microsoft Graph SDK.\"\n+Write-Host \"Certificate is uploaded successfully via Microsoft Graph SDK.\"\n ```\n \n ## Related content"
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response:
The changes update documentation for Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access.

*   The disclaimer for the TLS inspection feature has been refined to provide clearer guidance for preview users, particularly regarding production environments.
*   The number of regions for Microsoft's Wide Area Network has been updated from 140+ to 70.
*   Minor improvements have been made to PowerShell script output messages for clarity.

author: prmerger-automator[bot]
message:
Merge pull request #9746 from teresayao/tlsfaq

open SSL PS

  "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/27805e16bffa083b87335dddda9d0860576994e7/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fscripts%2Fpowershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md",
  "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fscripts%2Fpowershell-open-secure-sockets-layer.md?ref=27805e16bffa083b87335dddda9d0860576994e7",
  "patch": "@@ -63,7 +63,7 @@ try {\n     $response = Get-MgBetaNetworkAccessTlExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificate\n     if ($response.Count -gt 0) {\n         Write-Host \"A certificate for TLS inspection already exists.\"\n-\texit 1\n+\t    exit 1\n     } \n }\n catch {\n@@ -137,7 +137,7 @@ Write-Host \"Generating Root CA key and certificate...\"\n if (Test-Path $csrPath) {\n     Write-Host \"Signing CSR file $csrPath...\"\n     & $openSSLPath x509 -req -in $csrPath -CA $rootCert -CAkey $rootKey -CAcreateserial -out $signedCert -days 370 -sha256 -extfile $opensslCnfPath -extensions signedCA_ext\n-    Write-Host \"Signed certificate saved to $signedCert\"\n+    Write-Host \"Successfully saved signed certificate to $signedCert\"\n } else {\n     Write-Host \"CSR file '$csrPath' not found. Please generate it first.\"\n }\n@@ -147,8 +147,6 @@ $paramsupload = @{\n certificate = Get-Content -Path $SignedCert -Raw\n chain       = Get-Content -Path $RootCert -Raw\n }\n-# Upload using SDK cmdlet\n-Update-MgBetaNetworkAccessTlExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificate -ExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId $externalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId -BodyParameter $paramsupload\n \n # Upload the signed certificate and its chain to Microsoft Graph using the SDK cmdlet.\n # -ExternalCertificateAuthorityCertificateId: The unique ID of the certificate request previously created.\n@@ -160,7 +158,7 @@ Write-Error \"Failed to upload certificate and chain: $($_.Exception.Message)\"\n exit 1\n }\n \n-Write-Host \"Upload complete via Microsoft Graph SDK.\"\n+Write-Host \"Certificate is uploaded successfully via Microsoft Graph SDK.\"\n ```\n \n ## Related content"
}. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit addresses the PowerShell script for managing TLS inspection certificates within Microsoft Entra Global Secure Access. It refines the output messages for clarity and corrects an oversight where the SDK cmdlet for uploading the signed certificate was commented out, preventing its execution. The changes ensure the script accurately reports existing certificates and successfully uploads new ones.

author: Teresa Yao
message:
Merge branch 'main' into tlsfaq - resolve conflicts

- PowerShell script: keep resolved version with improved error handling and messages
- FAQ file: accept main branch version

{"content":"The following is the commit files that have changed: [
  {
    "sha": "b02c9f3cd9d645aff4871c46980e19dce67d31e4",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/concept-connectors.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 9,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 9,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-connectors.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-connectors.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fconcept-connectors.md?ref=423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c",
    "patch": "@@ -57,6 +57,15 @@ You can monitor your connectors from the machine they're running on, using eithe\n \n You don't have to manually delete connectors that are unused. When a connector is running, it remains active as it connects to the service. Unused connectors are tagged as `_inactive_` and are removed after 10 days of inactivity. If you do want to uninstall a connector, though, uninstall both the Connector service and the Updater service from the server. Restart the computer to fully remove the service.\n \n+## Handling Connector Server Issues\n+If one or more connector servers become unavailable (e.g., due to a server outage, network outage, or similar issue), follow these steps to maintain service continuity:\n+ \n+1.\tIdentify and remove the affected (“bad”) servers from the connector group.\n+2.\tAdd available healthy servers (“good”) or backup servers into the connector group to restore capacity.\n+3.\tReboot affected servers to drain any pre-existing connections. Existing ongoing connections don’t drain immediately with connector group changes.\n+ \n+This sequence is the recommended approach to ensure service stability and minimize disruption when connector servers encounter issues.\n+\n ## Connector updates\n \n Microsoft Entra ID occasionally provides automatic updates for all the connectors that you deploy. As long as the private network connector updater service is running, your connectors may update with the latest major connector release automatically. If you don’t see the Connector Updater service on your server, you need to reinstall your connector to get updates."
  },
  {
    "sha": "bf1d7591a400904fcf0fdee87ea897bc81676527",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/faq-transport-layer-security.yml",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 5,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 6,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Ffaq-transport-layer-security.yml",

    "patch": "@@ -30,7 +30,11 @@ sections:\n           - Define a TLS policy: Configure a TLS inspection policy that aligns with your organization's security and operational requirements.\n           - Configure Conditional Access: Create a Conditional Access policy and associate it with the Global Secure Access security profile linked to the TLS policy.\n           - Distribute the trusted certificate: Ensure the selected certificate authority is installed on all client devices to establish trust and enable seamless TLS inspection.\n-        \n+          \n+      - question: What cryptographic algorithms are supported for the Signing Certificate authority?\n+        answer: |\n+          SHA-256, SHA-384 and SHA-512 are supported for the Signing Certificate authority:\n+\n       - question: How do I Sign CSR Using the Active Directory Certificate Services (AD CS)\n         answer: |\n           TLS inspection requires an intermediate certificate authority, ensure you are using the Subordinate CA template. To sign CSR generated from TLS settings,"
  },
  {
    "sha": "ec531ea499a3a7986a723089eee7df3306d9c1fe",
    "filename": "docs/global-secure-access/how-to-configure-connectors.md",
    "status": "modified",

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fglobal-secure-access%2Fhow-to-configure-connectors.md",

    "patch": "@@ -27,7 +27,7 @@ User identities must be synchronized from an on-premises directory or created di\n \n ### Windows server\n \n-The Microsoft Entra private network connector requires a server running Windows Server 2012 R2 or later. You'll install the private network connector on the server. This connector server needs to connect to the Microsoft Entra Private Access service or application proxy service and the private resources or applications that you plan to publish.\n+The Microsoft Entra private network connector requires a server running Windows Server 2016 or later. You'll install the private network connector on the server. This connector server needs to connect to the Microsoft Entra Private Access service or application proxy service and the private resources or applications that you plan to publish.\n \n * For high availability in your environment, we recommend having more than one Windows server.\n * The minimum .NET version required for the connector is v4.7.1+."
  },
  {
    "sha": "e283ad22976dd98403a25f9b0fa5fcd8d7117e17",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/TOC.yml",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 2,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fid-governance%2FTOC.yml",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fid-governance%2FTOC.yml",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2FTOC.yml?ref=423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c",
    "patch": "@@ -247,6 +247,8 @@\n         href: entitlement-management-organization.md\n       - name: Govern access for external users\n         href: entitlement-management-external-users.md\n+      - name: Configure whether requestors can see approver details (Preview)\n+        href: my-access-approver-details.md  \n       - name: View reports and logs\n         href: entitlement-management-reports.md\n       - name: Archive logs and reporting"
  },
  {
    "sha": "eab6bb53d6da930d85eae5b595788725fae54358",
    "filename": "docs/id-governance/my-access-approver-details.md",
    "status": "added",
    "additions": 45,
    "deletions": 0,
    "changes": 45,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmy-access-approver-details.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmy-access-approver-details.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fid-governance%2Fmy-access-approver-details.md?ref=423ce8e616c281c131254ad52c35d00c332b659c",
    "patch": "@@ -0,0 +1,45 @@\n+---\n+title: Configure Requestor Visibility of Approver Details (Preview)\n+description: Learn how to configure whether requestors can see approver details for pending access package requests in the My Access portal at the tenant or package level.\n+author: OWinfreyATL\n+ms.service: entra-id-governance\n+ms.topic: how-to\n+ms.date: 08/20/2025\n+ms.author: owinfrey\n+ms.reviewer: owinfrey\n+---\n+\n+# Configure whether requestors can see approver details (Preview)\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> This feature will be widely available beginning in September 2025.\n+\n+Admins can control whether requestors see approver details for pending access package requests in the [My Access](https://myaccess.microsoft.com) portal. You can set this option at the access package level, or at the tenant level (default for all packages). The access package setting overrides the tenant setting when explicitly set to Yes or No.\n+\n+## Tenant-level setting (applies to all access packages by default)\n+\n+Use this setting to define the default behavior for all access packages in your tenant. This setting applies to **members only** and can be overridden by the access package-level setting.\n+\n+1. In the Microsoft Entra admin center, go to **Identity Governance** > **Entitlement management** > **Control configurations**.\n+\n+2. Under **My Access settings for end users**, find **Show approver details to members on pending access package requests (preview).**\n+\n+3. Choose the desired behavior:\n+\n+   - **Checked** – All members (excluding guests) will see their approver’s name and email address on pending access package requests in My Access.\n+\n+   - **Unchecked** – Members won’t see approver details by default.\n+\n+4. Select **Save**.\n+\n+> [!NOTE]\n+> - The tenant setting applies to all access packages by default but can be overridden on a per-package basis via Advanced request settings.\n+> - To show approver details to guests and connected organization users, set the access package-level setting to Yes.\n+\n+\n+\n+## Next step\n+\n+> [!div class=\"nextstepaction\"]\n+> [What are access reviews? - Microsoft Entra](access-reviews-overview.md)\n+> [What is the My Access portal?](my-access-portal-overview.md)\n\\ No newline at end of file"
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary.","role":"user"}
ai_summary.Response: This commit introduces several updates to Microsoft Entra documentation. New guidance on handling connector server issues is added to the concept connectors documentation. The FAQ for transport layer security now specifies supported cryptographic algorithms. The minimum Windows Server version for the Entra private network connector has been updated to 2016. Finally, new documentation has been added regarding the configuration of requestor visibility of approver details in the My Access portal for entitlement management.
